â
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[touchscreen]] [[Slate phone|slate]] [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to Googleâs previous flagship phones, the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]]. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system (Android 4.0, codenamed "Ice Cream Sandwich").<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between Samsung's ''Galaxy'' and Google's ''Nexus'' brands of Android smartphones.
+
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> is a forthcoming [[touchscreen]] [[Slate phone|slate]] [[Android (OS)|Android]] [[smartphone]] manufactured by [[Samsung]] for [[Google]]. The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to Googleâs previous flagship phones, the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]]. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system (Android 4.0, codenamed "Ice Cream Sandwich").<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between Samsung's ''Galaxy'' and [[Google Nexus|Google's ''Nexus'']] brands of Android smartphones.
The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsung's ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on 19 October, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]] (18th October in the Western Hemisphere). It is scheduled to be released in November, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=Gizmodo report}}</ref>
The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsung's ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on 19 October, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]] (18th October in the Western Hemisphere). It is scheduled to be released in November, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=Gizmodo report}}</ref>
